alert.note: Alert for Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 12:56PM MDT until August 19 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Kane County in southern Utah... East Central Washington County in southwestern Utah... * Until 445 PM MDT. * At 1256 PM MDT, Dopper radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the the north side of Zion National Park in vicinity of the headwaters of the Narrows, including the Narrows itself. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park and Springdale. This includes the following streams and drainages... Oak Creek, Crystal Creek, Virgin River, Clear Creek, Right Fork North Creek, North Creek, Kolob Creek, Little Creek, Blue Creek, North Fork Virgin River, East Fork Virgin River and Deep Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
